page.title: 02HENLEY - ON - THAMES
page.content: Henley takes its name from two Saxon words-HEN(old) & LEY(place) on high round.The manor was Kings land & so was not included in the Domesday Survey It is situated on the Thames among the Chiltern Hills.Access from Berkshire is by an 18th century BRIDGE on the site of a former wooden one.ST.MARYÂ£S stands on a church site since 1204 & the Tower is 16th century.It is in use today.The 14th century timbered CHANTRY HOUSE was a chapel for the priests.Today it is used for meetings.The ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH was built by 1949 & it is in use The 16th century RED LION HOTEL housed many famous people & is very popular today along with the Bear,Little White Hart & others.Henley STATION was opened in 1857 & it has been rebuilt this year The KENTON THEATRE dates from 1805 & BRAKSPEARÂ£S BREWERY from 1779.Both are in use today as is the HENLEY STANDARD.
